intro: Pseudolappula sinaica, commonly known as the Sinai lappula, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the Middle East and North Africa. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many economically important crops such as cabbage and mustard. The plant is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Pseudolappula sinaica is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
